001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump;
002
003import org.apache.commons.io.output.StringBuilderWriter;
004import org.apache.commons.io.output.WriterOutputStream;
005
006import java.io.IOException;
007import java.io.OutputStream;
008import java.io.PrintStream;
009import java.io.PrintWriter;
010import java.io.Writer;
011import java.util.stream.Stream;
012
013/**
014 * A {@link PrintWriter} over {@link StringBuilderWriter} that could simplify
015 * the substitution of {@link System#out} and {@link System#err} in unit-tests,
016 * and it's also used by other classes of the current package.
017 */
018public class StringBuilderOut extends PrintStream implements CharSequence {
019    private final StringBuilderWriter sbw;
020
021    StringBuilderOut(StringBuilderWriter sbw) {
022        super(outputStream(sbw));
023        this.sbw = sbw;
024    }
025
026    static OutputStream outputStream(Writer originWriter) {
027        try {
028            return WriterOutputStream.builder()
029                .setWriter(originWriter)
030                .setWriteImmediately(true)
031                .get();
032        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
033            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
034                "could not create a wrapper over originWriter - " + originWriter,
035                ioEx);
036        }
037    }
038
039    public static StringBuilderOut create() {
040        return new StringBuilderOut(new StringBuilderWriter());
041    }
042
043    public StringBuilder stringBuilder() {
044        return sbw.getBuilder();
045    }
046
047    public void clear() {
048        stringBuilder().setLength(0);
049    }
050
051    public int length() {
052        return stringBuilder().length();
053    }
054
055    @Override
056    public String toString() {
057        return stringBuilder().toString();
058    }
059
060    public Stream<String> lines() {
061        return toString().lines();
062    }
063
064    public int linesCount() {
065        return Math.toIntExact(lines().count());
066    }
067
068    @Override
069    public char charAt(int index) {
070        return stringBuilder().charAt(index);
071    }
072
073    @Override
074    public CharSequence subSequence(int start, int end) {
075        return stringBuilder().subSequence(start, end);
076    }
077}
